content.description: Layback the sit-start, hooking your left hand under the notch next to the sidepull. Work your hands up, then move to the next sidepull. With feet higher, pull the last two moves to the top. Mantle finish.
content.location: This is a short, four to five move problem with a sit-start on a boulder located behind the main area toward the river. Walk downhill from the v1s on the left end (climbers left). The problem is on the side facing the river.

content.description: Starts with a large pocket and under cling at head height. Begins with technical moves on small slick feet leading to a few harder moves right on sharp crimps, and finishes with easier big moves between progressively better holds. Great rock, cool moves, and a proud top-out make this thing a proud tick for any local or visiting boulderer
content.protection: Two pads and a spotter should do it
content.location: In the middle of the Depot area, it starts on a wide, blank face with partially scrubbed-away graffiti saying "domer"

content.description: Starts on a big block wedged in the crack and traverses left across jugs at the top of the slab. Finish past a big slot.
content.location: Starts in the next crack right from Block Crack. (Shared start with Mossy Rock)

content.description:
Start with your left hand on a pinch and your right hand low on the right side of the block. Make a few powerful moves before making your way up and over the lip. The climb ends at the obvious jug halfway up the wall. Walk off to the left or drop down if you have the appropriate pads and spotters. 

 Use only the loose block between the crack at the start for full V5 credit. Using the other footholds in reach makes this about a V3.
content.location: Located just left of the big crack to the left of Ginsu.

content.description: Start on Ministry (sit start) and traverse right on good edges/pockets to Filth Pig's jug pockets and top out.
content.location: Ministry into Filth Pig

content.description: Climb the finger crack to the right of the Wizard. Slick feet and locker fingers leads to an angle change. The crack pinches down higher so mandatory moves between finger-pods required.
content.location: Finger crack to the right of the Wizard.

content.description: A great compression problem that starts immediately right of The Goblin.  Begin on a good flat edge and work up to a right crimpy sidepull.  Squeeze and slap your way up to good opposing sidepulls on the arete while standing on the start hold. More intense moves (crux for some) lead to the horizontal below the large block which is often dirty.  Traverse right and easily top out via the wide crack above.
content.location: Starts immediately right of the goblin, maybe 10-15' left of Blood Knuckle

content.description: Starts matched on a chest height sloper, also the start hold for Big Easy, but goes left up a slanting seam cutting through a cool shield leading to a hard move to a blocky undercling/sidepull and even harder cross to a miserable rail. After a few more hard moves it rejoins the Big Easy at the obvious mail slot and shares the same top out
content.protection: couple pads are nice, the  last few moves before hitting the mail slot are up there a bit
content.location: between Ginsu and The Big Easy, shares start hold and top out with Big Easy.

content.description: Climb the arete from a stand start. Long and somewhat committing moves between good edges up high are the crux.
content.location: The prow to the right of the Wizard.

content.description: Underrated highball on the right side of the Depot. Start left of Blood Knuckle and right of Hot Iron and look for a right-facing fin high up. Start below the fin on the left, climb up the ramp and reach out right to small edges and a mono. Make your way over to the fin and layback it all the way to the top. Excellent climbing, rarely done?The Scab V6+: linkup from Blood Knuckle onto the fin of the Petrifier. Guidebook lists it as V6 but I think it is harder than the Petrifier, since you have to do the cruxy first move of Blood Knuckle then traverse left on very small crimps and then turn the other way onto the layback of Petrifier. Even more rarely done.
content.location: right side of the Depot, left of Blood Knuckle, right of Hot Iron, in between the tree and the wall

content.description:
Start on some low holds to the left of the corner and move right for a few moves. Pull past some sidepulls up the vertical section. Maneuver past the hanging tree branches while topping out on the mossy slab. 

 The first section is fun but the topout is awful.
content.location: The obvious bulge in the rock that seperates the Filth Pig/Traverse Wall from the Ginsu section.

content.description: Easy warm up, great view up top.Start on the massive side pull on the left side of the wall and work you’re way up. Don’t fall.
content.location: Flake crack to corner, two aretes right of The Wizard.

content.description: Start on the big block wedged in the crack and follow the crack.
content.location: Starts in the next crack right from Block Crack. (Shared start with Wet Mail)

content.description: Start on the low holds. The first move is the crux, a long reach to a good undercling. Move up past a slopey hold and climb to the top on good edges.
content.location: Immediately left of Filth Pig on the same starting holds as Stoney Baloney.

content.description:
Starts on an uncomfortably sharp RH crimp and a good vertical LH pinch in a crack at head/chest height. A few long moves on progressively better holds lead up and slightly right to a much easier, albeit tall, finish. 

  you are unlikely to hit the tree behind you if you fall, but a spotter there definitely helps with the pucker factor.
content.location: ~20yds up river (climber's right) of The Wizard, on the right face of a right-facing corner.

content.description: Start right and low of the corner on a large rail. Move up to a sharp pocket. Move left and make some huge, reachy moves using side pulls along the arete. Finish up on good holds.
content.location: Golden corner to the right of Blood Knuckle

content.description: Ginsu sit-starts the obvious gently overhung blade-like feature ~8ft left of The Big Easy. Some foot trickery and a well-placed heel hook bring you across the blade, first right, then left through a good side pull and into a finish jug. Tops out up high and right on easier terrain, although some stop at the jug.
content.protection: one or two pads and a spotter is nice
content.location: ~8 feet left (downstream) of The Big Easy

content.description: Starts on a good hold to the right of the crack next to Discman. Move up and right to the ledge and topout on the right using the big flake.
content.location: Directly to the right of the crack next to Discman.

content.description: Starts on a large flake at head height and moves through a large horizontal crack up into a massive jagged pocket before the crux moves on narrow 3-finger pockets. A sit start from the low flake around the corner to the left is worth doing and bumps the grade up  notch or two.
content.location: Left most route on the cliff band as you enter the main area.

content.description: Starts on a big high hold and goes up the corner.
content.location: Immediately to the right of Filth Pig.

content.description: Sit start on off-kilter and move up and left through a series of hard moves and good rests. Finish with the crux moves at the top of filth pig.
Cool compression problem with some crimps and some slick feet
"Step off the white ledge and climb one exposed move on the face left of 'The Goblin'" - Central Oregon Bouldering

Start with hands matched at the bottom side pull thing just to the left of the crack and move to the really good jug just above the start hold and in the crack. Moving through the smooth and slopey crack is certainly the crux until you make it to the big jug that’s formed by the widening crack halfway up. Once you’ve made it there, the problem is about over and all that’s left to do is top the boulder. Feet at the end are very obvious and I just mantled up once my arms were above the edge. You have to be a little creative with the feet at the beginning but there are a few good smears and some good toe jams as well. Fun problem over all.
content.protection: Very flat all I needed was one pad but two wouldn’t hurt.
content.location: Just to the right of bloody knuckles. Obvious because of the precariously perched boulders above the problem.

content.description: Make a big move out of the starting finger locks to a good hold or use the intermediate crimp. Top out after a few more big moves on good holds.
content.location: Starts with both hands in the obvious finger crack. Located on the tan and black outcropping cliff to the right of The Goblin.

content.description: Climb the blocky crack up and around the right side of the large flake.
content.location: The first crack to the right of Fred.

content.description: The intimidating Depot warm-up. A few big moves between great holds lead to a somewhat disconcerting crux at the lip around 20 feet.
content.location: Directly left of The Wizard. Will likely be the most chalked route in the area.

content.description: Walk upstream from the Goblin about 100 yards and you'll find a small buttress near the rapids, the Outkast Buttress. Start on the ramp with big jug and climb up, then left to the flake/block feature that looks sus but is most likely solid. Probably has been done before so if there's an already-existing name, please suggest update.
content.location: 100 yards upstream of the Goblin & Grantelope, small buttress right near where the rapids start.

content.description: Walk upstream from the Goblin about 100 yards and you'll find a small buttress near the rapids, the Outkast Buttress. Start on the ramp with big jug and climb up, then right to the arete. Probably has been done before so if there's an already-existing name, please suggest update.
content.location: 100 yards upstream of the Goblin & Grantelope, small buttress right near where the rapids start.

content.description: Links from Ginsu into the Rack via a pretty sharp traverse including a hard match, double gastons and a cool stab to catch the seam at the beginning of the Rack and joining that problem one move in. Makes the shouldery opening moves on the Rack feel a lot harder.
content.protection: couple pads, basically a sit start and a traverse into a bit of a highball
content.location: Climb Ginsu from the sit start then traverse right into the Rack

content.description: A small cliff band made of Basalt on the Deschutes River. The cliff band is on a popular Bend hiking trail and you'll be sharing the area with hikers. The problems are tall but the landings are all pretty good.
